posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
I've started playing on WoG and it's been a ton of fun! Now it's time to put that hard-won experience to the test.

I really appreciate that the WoG Ranger has 6 skill points per level, as this allows from interesting builds. The Versatile Ranger was built around the concept of a "Retributor". The build was inspired by: 
http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 23420.html 

This retributor was a skilled Ranger who was burned out of his home by the minions of the Pomaj. Now he stalks the forests (high Hide / Move silently) pursuing rustic revenge (Assassin). Life in the woods is hard, so he must make do with whatever he can find (no weapon focus but can use any weapon).  He recently saved an Elvish Mage and she taught him a few tricks to help with his crusade (high UMD). He was outnumbered in that fight, but skillful use of homemade traps (high craft and set traps), deft maneuver (high Tumble) and discipline won the day. In the aftermath, he grimly looted the bodies and bargained the lot for a fair price in Borderkeep (some Appraisal).  

The advantages / disadvantages are:
- Low hit points (Elves...). Hopefully this can be protected by using a sword and shield, high tumble, animal companion and the full Ranger spell list.
- No dev crit. To compensate this build provides Bane of Enemies and Death Attack.
-Only 37 AB normally, 39 AB against Bane enemies. Perhaps the ability to use any weapon will provide opportunities to improve this.
- Low saves. Compensated by taking Epic Will, Fortitude and Reflexes. Also some racial and class saves.
- Animal companion. A good distraction early on, but likely to become a snack for an epic level Boss
- Cannot wear heavy armour, but gains +8 AC via Tumble.
- High UMD to provide additional flexibility
- Decent Move Silently / Hide, which can be boosted by Woodland Stride, Ranger spells and items.
- Jack of all trades, but master of none. I suspect this build will be fun early on, but struggle to fill a specific role in an epic level party.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Nice.  I really like the idea and thought behind this, and I think it would be fun to play.  If you don't mind, I'll offer you some of my insights.  There is a lot of synergy between Ranger and Assassin.  The Ranger provides great stealth buffs to enhance the Assassin as well as lending  Ultravision to couple with the Assassin's Darkness ability.  Let's get to it:

1.  Start you Wisdom at 14 and drop your Strength to 14.  This will net you an extra feat in Epic and you can still end with a 24 Strength.
2.  Dexterity.  I think you can get away with a 16 Dex by combining one decent Dex item with Ranger's Cat's Grace and/or an Ion Stone of Dexterity.  This could allow you to get your Strength to 26 for another point of AB.  Padded Armor and +12 to Dex will be optimal (but could be challenging to combine all the necessary gear.
3.  I know some changes were made to the Assassin class in the environment where you are playing.  Epic Prowess is considered to be a bonus feat for Assassins.  You can select that on Assassin 14 (drop Epic Reflexes) and then choose another feat where you had Epic Prowess.
4. FEs:  I drop one of those for Giants.  Probably Constructs would get the axe.
5.  You can safely take UMD to 31 (32) to insure 100% success rate on all scroll casting.  Orion like 33, but I find 31 is enough.  
6.  Since you are not Dex-based, and because you are not going Dev Crit path, Power Attack-- and subsequently Cleave -- are of limited utility in this build.  I would exchange those for Weapon Focus and something else, and then take EWF where you had Prowess.
7. Final class split.  I feel like something is missing.  Evasion maybe?  Hide in Plain Sight.  You could drop that last Assassin level and put in Monk or, if you can squeeze the Dodge/Mobility feats, Shadowdancer.  Or, if you are married to Ranger/Assassin only, drop the last Assassin level for Ranger 26 for another bonus feat.

There, that's it.  Cheers!

posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
Much appreciated Grizzled!

I feel a lot more comfortable with the build at AB 40 now :-)

Changes are:
- Dropped UMD to 31(32);
- WF and EWF in the Morningstar;
- Dropped STR to 14 and boosted WIS to 14;
- Changed a Favored Enemy to Giants;
- a single Great Strength feat replaced with EWF: Longbnow;
- Kept DEX 16 and changed all ability increases to STR, netting a final STR 26;
- Class Split is now Rgr 26 / Asn 14 for an extra epic feat;
- Power attack and cleave have been replace by WF Longbow and Improved critical: Longbow

Epic prowess to be picked up at (WoG) Asn 14 for more AB goodness :-)

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Great work with the build SnorriHT and GDL.
Haven't seen a great ranger build for a while.

One tweak I would consider is Ranger 25 / Assassin 13 / Shadowdancer 2, which would provide HiPS and Evasion.
Both HiPS and Evasion provide a lot to the build, especially with Camouflage and One with the Land and other outdoor bonuses for huge stealth scores 
I think Dodge and Mobility could be swapped for Point Blank Shot and Power Attack

Cleave can be changed for a weapon focus in a dual wielding slashing weapon (rangers get ITWF for free in light armor), my preference with a Str based ranger with exotic weapon proficiency, is the two-bladed sword, you are much harder to disarm than a kukri wielder. Kukri or Shortsword/Handaxe would allow you to switch between one handed + shield and dual wielding though.

With Set Trap, due to Take 20 you should aim for Set Trap 15 modified unless you plan to set traps during combat. One with the land will add +4 to set trap, Cat's will add +1-2, so you could even manage with a set trap score of 10-11. Without rogue in the build you will never be able to set epic traps.
Craft trap is too high at 30 modified, drop it to modified 19-25 for a 50% chance of crafting deadly electrical/fire traps, it can be buffed with int potions and items of trap crafting
Tumble you should put 40 ranks for the AC bonus so 40(44) is enough
I would put remaining points to max out stealth but I have no experience playing a build with stealth high 20s at lvl 40 even with the buffs with camouflage if you have the skill points you may as well try to do it well
A higher spot score (40+) and listen around 20-30 would be what I would aim for if I have the points

Just with the UMD on WoG, please note DM Wise only switched on the hardcore spell check with scrolls in the last week or so.
MrZork's advice was modified UMD 31, however I do feel a little uncertain about that advice given it was switched off for the player base over a number of years.

My practice is to go on what is recommended on the NWN Wiki: Use Magical Device, which states 
- a DC check of 25 + the level of the spell to cast a spell from a scroll

For 100% success with lvl 9 scrolls, 25 + 9 = 34, so modified UMD 33 (as the lowest roll is 1) is enough to always pass the check, if it is as listed in described in the NWN Wiki
I credit Hip's guide to UMD on this forum as well to help me make that decision. 
My opinion is 31 is enough for 90% success for lvl 9 scrolls and 95% success for lvl 8 scrolls, but if you have a spare two skill points, why not just put it to 33.

Overall your mileage may vary on WoG depending on how it all works but I suspect it should work as described in the Wiki, even if it isn't, I like to 'future proof' builds that I play, in case the environment changes, if that makes any sense, PW constantly change as described with the checks being switched on.
